HPI 8004 Toyota Celica GT-Four (ST185) 1992 Safari Rally Kenya Winner C. Sainz/L. Moya

Purchased: 2011
Manufacturer page: http://www.hpimodelcar.com/line_up/pop/8004/8004.html

In 1992 Toyota Team Europe prepared a massive attack on the Safari Rally, an event Toyota had already won four times in the previous decade. Three new ST185s were joined by several old-style ST165s in private hands, with major 'works' competition coming only from Lancia, this looked like a serious effort from Toyota.

Although Lancia fought hard, this was an event almost made for Carlos Sainz to win - which he duly did, actually leading at the vast majority of time controls. The huge team was in high spirits - at one point Carlos' car suffered a turbo failure, Carlos asked for a change, and the work was duly completed in just 8 minutes. In the end he defeated Juha Kankkunen's Lancia by a massive 52 minutes. This was an astonishing performance for a car (a body shell type, really) which was brand new to Africa.

I finally found some Marlboro decals on Yahoo! Japan to finish the livery on this one. Unfortunately the bonnet decal didn't conform to the curves too well but you can only notice it in the photos.

10th WRC win for Carlos Sainz.
23rd WRC win for Toyota.
First WRC win for ST185.
